Extension.name: setCookie
Extension.initParam: Sets a cookie in the HTML response document.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: name
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (required) The name of the cookie.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: value
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (required) The value of the cookie.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: expires
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) The date the cookie expires. Use 'EEE, dd-MMM-yyyy hh:mm:ss z' as the date format (date or time may be omitted). Use 'literal' as the value type.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: domain
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) The domain name of the host from which the URI is accessed.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: path
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) only sends the cookie when accessing a URI under the specified path on the host. This includes the path and all descendents. For instance, using \"/\" matches all URI specifications on the host.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: isSecure
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) this is a boolean value. When set to \"1\", the cookie will only be sent when a secure (SSL) connection has been established. When set to \"0\" or \"\", any connection type is acceptable.

Extension.initParam: This exit can be used on an update resource that uploads a file to database to calculate the file size in bytes and optionally get current date time to be used as modified date.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FileContentParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The HTML parameter name that contains the content of the uploaded file. More specifically, the name attribute value of the tag <input type=file name=contentbody> in the source HTML, i.e. in this example, contentbody.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FileSizeParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the HTML parameter that gets the value of file size. Always literal. This will be used in the mapper to put the size value to the database.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the HTML parameter that gets current datetime stamp. Always literal. This will be used in the mapper to put the file modified date to the database.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateFormatString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Datetime format string. Always a literal. e.g. yyyy/MM/dd hh:mm:ss - Note that this may depend on the backend that the file is saved to. Default is MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss a

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FileSizeMax
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Maximum size limit for file. If the file to be uploaded exceeds this value, exception is thrown.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FileSizeParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the HTML parameter that gets the value of file size. Always literal. This will be used in the mapper to put the size value to the database.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the HTML parameter that gets current datetime stamp. Always literal. This will be used in the mapper to put the file modified date to the database.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateFormatString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Datetime format string. Always a literal. e.g. yyyy/MM/dd hh:mm:ss - Note that this may depend on the backend that the file is saved to. Default is MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss a

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FileSizeMax
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Maximum size limit for file. If the file to be uploaded exceeds this value, exception is thrown.

Extension.name: sys_SetCookie
Extension.initParam: Sets a cookie in the HTML response document.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: name
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (required) The name of the cookie.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: value
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (required) The value of the cookie.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: expires
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) The date the cookie expires. Use 'EEE, dd-MMM-yyyy hh:mm:ss z' as the date format (date or time may be omitted). Use 'literal' as the value type.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: domain
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) The domain name of the host from which the URI is accessed.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: path
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) only sends the cookie when accessing a URI under the specified path on the host. This includes the path and all descendents. For instance, using \"/\" matches all URI specifications on the host.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: isSecure
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) this is a boolean value. When set to \"1\", the cookie will only be sent when a secure (SSL) connection has been established. When set to \"0\" or \"\", any connection type is acceptable.

PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the input file list <filelist>.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fileTreeName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the output tree. Defaults to <filetree>

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: filePathName

Extension.name: sys_FileInfo
Extension.initParam: Scans the server's HTML parameter map and for each file object it finds, it creates 0 or more metadata parameters and adds them to the map. The information it attempts to add is: filepath, filename, extension, MIME type, character encoding, and size. If it can find the information, the parameter is added, otherwise nothing is added for that property. The naming convention for the additional parameters is originalname_property. The corresponding property parameter suffixes are: _fullFilepath, _filename, _ext, _type, _encoding, _size, respectively.

Extension.initParam: Move the XML input document into an HTML parameter. This is required if you need to store XML documents in a Rhythmyx field.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: HTMLParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the HTML parameter where the document will be stored

Extension.name: sys_xdDomToParams
Extension.initParam: Copy the children of <PSXParam> to HTML parameters

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sourceName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of source XML document object

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: appendParameter
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: If set to "yes" the value will be appended to an existing parameter of the same name. If not set or set to "no" value will replace existing parameter with the same name.

Extension.name: sys_xdCopyDom
Extension.initParam: Copy a DOM tree fragment into the result document

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sourceObjectName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of source object. Defaults to XMLDOM

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sourceNodeName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of source node. Leave blank to copy the entire document

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: destNodeName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of destination node.

Extension.name: sys_xdDomToText
Extension.initParam: Copy a node or document from XML to Text

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SourceObjectName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of source document object

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SourceNode
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of source node. Leave blank to copy the entire document

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DestinationName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Destination field or node

Extension.name: sys_xdDomToFile
Extension.initParam: Copy a node or document from XML to Text

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SourceObjectName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of source document object

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SourceNode
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of source node. Leave blank to copy the entire document

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DestinationName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Destination field name

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Encoding
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Java name of encoding to use when writing the file

Extension.name: sys_xdRemoveElements
Extension.initParam: Remove one or more elements from the result document

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: element1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of element to remove

Extension.name: sys_xdTransformDomToText
Extension.initParam: Transform an XML document and store the result as text

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SourceName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of Source DOM object

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: StyleSheet
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Stylesheet within the current application

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DestName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of destination parameter or node

Extension.name: sys_PrepareInClause
Extension.initParam: Formats a string from all objects in a Collection that is a valid "IN" clause for a query. Performs a toString() on each object in the collection. The result does not include the parentheses.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: baseName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The base name to use for the parameter created.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramObject
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The Collection to use to create the values. May be null or empty.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: defaultValue
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A value to use in the event that the Collection is null does not contain any non-null entries.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: encloseInQuotes
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) this is a boolean value. When set to "1", each object in the collection is enclosed in single quotes. When set to "0" the object is not enclosed in quotes. Defaults to "1".

Extension.name: sys_AddCurrentDateTime
Extension.initParam: Adds the current date and time (on Rhythmyx server) as an HTML Parameter (name is the first parameter to the exit) to the provided request. Formatted according to the provided format pattern or to the default (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss) if no format pattern provided.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: htmlParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the HTML parameter to be added to the provided request. Not null or empty.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: formatPattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The pattern to use to format the current date and time. May be null or empty.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: dateOffset
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Sets an offset for the current date causing the exit to return a date adjusted by the number of days passed in as the offset integer value. Negative values will offset the date backwards. May be null or empty.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: truncate
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: If set to "yes" it will truncate the date result time to 12:00:00 AM . May be null or empty.

Extension.name: sys_ceDependencyTree
Extension.initParam: Generates the XML tree for all child and parent items of the current item. Used by dependency viewer in the content editors. Makes repeated internal requests to expand the parents and children.

Extension.name: sys_removeControlChars
Extension.initParam: This exit will remove control characters from all fields in a content editor. These characters are illegal in XML and will cause an exception if they are left in.

Extension.name: sys_SetSessionVariable
Extension.initParam: Sets variable in private session object based upon html parameter

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: param_name
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of html parameter

Extension.name: sys_GetSessionVariable
Extension.initParam: Gets a variable from session object and populates html parameter with it.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: param_name
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of html parameter

Extension.name: sys_SetProviderTypeInstance
Extension.initParam: Splits security provider information using separator and sets the provider type and instance in to 2 html parameters

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: securityParameterName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Security Provider Information

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: separator
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Separator used for splitting the security provider information

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: providerTypeParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: HTML Parameter name for provider type

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: securityInstanceParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: HTML Parameter name for security instance name

Extension.name: sys_cmpMenuTree
Extension.initParam:
This exit builds a cascaded menu item list XML document by making multiple internal requests to a rhythmyx resource. The tree we get depends on the data in the backend tables RXSYSCOMPONENTS and RXSYSCOMPONENTRELATIONS. The XML document generated shall be as follows:
<menuitem name="ca_inbox" id="20" type="2"> <displaytext>Inbox</displaytext> <description>Items assigned to me</description> <url>http://10.10.10.56:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_ca/camain.html?sys_sortparam=title&sys_componentname=ca_inbox</url> <userrolesurl>http://127.0.0.1:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_cmpUserStatus/userstatus.xml?pssessionid=8037ca1cbcc8bd31e3db8b392d4fff8c62c9dacc</userrolesurl> <contexturl>http://127.0.0.1:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_ComponentSupport/componentcontext.xml?pssessionid=8037ca1cbcc8bd31e3db8b392d4fff8c62c9dacc&sys_componentid=20</contexturl> <componentname>ca_inbox</componentname> <childitem id="1"/> <childitem id="2"/> <childitem id="6"/> <childitem id="7"/> </menuitem>
Multiple requests are made to expand each child item to menu item. Used to generate the navigation bars in the content administrator.

Extension.name: sys_casAddAssemblerInfo
Extension.initParam: This post exit adds information needed in content assembler stylesheets to the result document. An XML document conforming to the DTD sys_AssemblerInfo.dtd is created and inserted into the result document as its first child. In the second part the exit modifies the assembly style sheets to add extra links to edit the related content in preview or WYSIWYG mode (active assembly). This exit needs to be added to almost every assembly application resource.

Extension.name: sys_casModifyRelatedContent
Extension.initParam: This exit handles all modify related content item actions, viz. insert items into a slot, move an item up in the slot, delete an item from the slot, move an item down in the slot and move the item to another slot or change the item variant within the slot. The approach taken is to create an XML document that can go to the update resource as an input document. The DBActionType parameter shall be set based on whether we are inserting new rows, updating or deleting existing row(s).

Extension.name: sys_cmpAddAllParamsToUrl
Extension.initParam:
This pre-exit adds all HTML parameters in the request to the specified URLs. The urls are specified as the first children of the root element in the result document. For example, the result document <root> <url1>/Rhythmyx/sampleApp/samplePage1.htm</url1> <url2>/Rhythmyx/sampleApp/samplePage2.htm</url2> </root>
shall become
<root> <url1>/Rhythmyx/sampleApp/samplePage1.htm?param1=value1&param2=value2</url1> <url2>/Rhythmyx/sampleApp/samplePage2.htm?param1=value1&param2=value2</url2> </root>
if the request came with the HTML parameters param1 and param2. The parameter "pssessionid" is always skipped. Right now its restricted in the sense that it modifies all children and grand children of the root that have the element name specified. Also, it does not modify the URLs if to be the attributes of an element.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: UrlElementName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the unique element name storing the URL value

Extension.name: sys_MakeDeleteTableRowsXMLDoc
Extension.initParam: Makes an XML document to delete multiple content items from the content administrator.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyParameterName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the html parameter that has the key parameter value(s)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyParameterName1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the second html parameter that forms a part of the key parameter value. This can only be specified if deleting a single row. This parameter is ignored if the first parameter is multi-valued (for example, when deleting multiple rows).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyParameterName2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the third html parameter that forms a part of the key parameter value. This can only be specified if deleting a single row. This parameter is ignored if the first parameter is multi-valued (for example, when deleting multiple rows).

Extension.name: perc_casGeneratePreviewLink
Extension.initParam: Generates the preview link for pages and assets.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The content ID of the page or asset for which this should create preview link.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revision
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The revision of the page or asset for which this should create preview link.

Extension.name: perc_casGenerateReadOnlyLink
Extension.initParam: Generates the read-only editor view link for pages and assets.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The content ID of the page or asset for which this should create read-only link, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revision
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The revision of the page or asset for which this should create read-only link, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: host
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The host to be used in the read-only link, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: port
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The port to be used in the read-only link, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: useHttps
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: True if the read-only link should be created as https, false to create the link as http, required.

Extension.name: sys_casGeneratePubLocation
Extension.initParam: Generates the public location for the current context.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: variantid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The variantid for which this should create location url's, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The contentid for which this should create location url's, optional. If not provided the contentid of the current request will be taken.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revision
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The revision for which this should create location url's, optional. If not provided the revision of the current request will be taken.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: context
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Value of the context that overrides the default value specified by the HTML parameter sys_context, optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: siteid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Value of the target siteid that overrides the default value specified by the HTML parameter sys_siteid, optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: siteFolderid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Value of the target site folder id that overrides the default value specified by the HTML parameter sys_folderid, optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: authtype
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Value of the authtype that overrides the default value specified by the HTML parameter sys_authtype, optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: filtername
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Value of the item filter. If provided this will be passed to any preview url generated as the parameter sys_itemfilter. If the filter has a defined legacy authtype, the value will be used in preference to the authtype parameter, optional.

Extension.name: sys_casDefaultAssemblyLocation
Extension.initParam: Concatenates the specified parameters to generate the assembly location and adds the contentid before the suffix.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: root
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The root part of the location url to be created, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: path
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The resource path part of the location to be created, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: suffix
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The suffix part of the location to be created, required.

Extension.name: sys_casConcatAssemblyLocation
Extension.initParam: Concatenates all parameters to generate the assembly location.

Extension.name: sys_casConcatWithIdAssemblyLocation
Extension.initParam: Concatenates all parameters to generate the assembly location. The first parameter specifies the index where to append the contentid.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: index
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Specifies the index where to append the contentid, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The contentid for which this should create the location url, optional. If not provided the contentid of the current request will be taken.

Extension.name: sys_caDeleteContent
Extension.initParam: This extension builds a content item list for deletion by the Rhythmyx update resource after deleting data from the content type specific tables by making internal requests to the content editor's purge resource. If the attempt to delete this data fails for any reason we add this item to skipped item list for deletion. The DTD for the document is: <!ELEMENT deleterows (row*, skipped) > <!ELEMENT row (#PCDATA) > <!ATTLIST row pkey CDATA #IMPLIED > <!ELEMENT skipped (row*) > This exit shall typically placed on an Rx update resource that deletes the rows from all system tables. The XML element pkey must be mapped to the primary key in the backed table(s).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyParameterName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the html parameter that has the key parameter value(s)

Extension.name: sys_ServerUserRoleSearch
Extension.initParam: This exit can modify the result document by adding search results for the following cases: 1. Given the HTML parameter sys_command=GetRoles, it produces the list of server roles like: <root><role>role1</role><role>role2</role></root>. 2. Given the HTML parameters sys_command=GetUsers and sys_role=roleName, it produces the list of users that are members of the role roleName like: <root><role>roleName<user>user1</user><user>role2</user></role></root>. The element root indicates any Document Element of the result document.

Extension.name: perc_LockLocalContent
Extension.initParam: This workflow action revision locks local content.

Extension.name: sys_TouchParentItems
Extension.initParam: This workflow action touches all "parent" items of the current item. These items are found by searching the related content table for parent items, and then searching for the parents of those items, etc.

Extension.name: sys_TouchItemsWorkflowAction
Extension.initParam: This workflow action touches navigation related items.

Extension.name: sys_TouchContentAndParentItems
Extension.initParam: This pre-exit touches 0 or more content parent items.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sys_contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: the content id that has to be touched along with its 0 or more parent items (required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: maxLookupRecursions
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: indicates how many times the exit will recurse looking up parent items, (optional), the default is 'unlimited', any number greater then 0 indicates how many times the lookup will recurse

Extension.name: sys_SetHtmlParameter
Extension.initParam: This pre-exit sets / creates or removes a single request parameter.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: param name, (required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramValue
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: param value, (optional), if no value is passed in the exit will remove a parameter from the request object.

Extension.name: sys_CopyParameter
Extension.initParam: Duplicates the request parameter named by the exit parameter "source" into the request parameter named by the exit parameter "destination"

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: source
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: request parameter name to be copied

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: destination
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: request parameter name to receive copy

Extension.name: sys_BinaryChooser
Extension.initParam: Compares the first param to the 2nd param as Strings. If they are equal, the 3rd param is returned, otherwise the 4th param is returned. The comparison is performed case insensitive. If the first param is empty or null, the 3rd param is returned without performing a compare.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: leftComparand
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Left side of comparison.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: rightComparand
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Right side of comparison.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: equalsResult
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Returned if 1st 2 params are equal (case insensitive).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: notEqualsResult
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Returned if 1st 2 params are not equal (case insensitive).

Extension.name: sys_AppendUserRoles
Extension.initParam: Appends user roles as child elements to the root element of the document for example as, <root><UserRoles><Role>Admin</Role><Role>Author</Role></UserRoles></root>.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: UserRolesElementName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional element name for 'UserRoles' element. The default is 'UserRoles'.

Extension.name: sys_cmpDeleteChildCompRelations
Extension.initParam: This is a special exit makes an internal request to delete the child component relations from RXSYSCOMPONENTRELATIONS table.

Extension.name: sys_commAuthenticateUser
Extension.initParam: This exit authenticates the current user by means of his role-community membership. The following is the list of things that happen: 1. If the communities feature is disabled (by setting communities_enabled=no in Server.properties file, the passes the authentication and the user's communityid is set to 0 and stored as user's session object. Otherwise, 2. User community is obtained form the session assuming it stored previously 3. If does not exist in user's session, tries to recover it from Cookies assuming that the session object is lost because of server session timeout 4. Authentication fails if user has no community after the above step. 5. Exit now gets a list of user's role-communities by making an internal request 6. if the list contains the user community, user authentication succeeds 7. Authentications fails, otherwise 8. If authentication is successful, the user community is stored as session object to make sure it is available to all Rhythmyx applications for further use

Extension.name: sys_psxOverrideCommunity
Extension.initParam: Allows the caller to override the community used for the given request. Both arguments are required. Note that null is a valid argument for bypass.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: bypass
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Pass true if this exit should bypass the override.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: community
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Pass the override community to use

Extension.name: sys_ReplaceResultDocument
Extension.initParam:
This exit can be used where you need to execute conditional internal requests. Rhythmyx server does not support internal requests based on the resource names and needs the pipe name or internal request names today. To overcome this restriction one can use this exit. To use this exit one needs to do the following: 1. Create other resource that need to be executed conditionally by probably cloning the original and modifying suitably and give proper internal names (pipe names) 2. Place this exit on the original resource 3. Give the name of the default resource name to execute as the first parameter 4.Second parameter must be the value of the condition to choose the request from the following choices 5.Third, fifth, seventh etc.. should be the option values for the conditions 6. Fourth, sixth, eighth etc.. should be the corresponding request names. These are the resources you created in the workbench based on the original resource
One can a give an empty value for the resource name corresponding to a choice in which case the original document shall not be touched. If the value corresponding to the second parameter is available in the options, corresponding resource is executed, otherwise default request (first parameter) is executed and the result document's root element is replaced with that of the result of the execution of the internal request.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DefaultRequestName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Value of the condition to choose the internal request

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ConditionValue
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First condition value

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FirstOptionValue
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First choice value for the condition.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FirstInternalRequestName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of corresponding internal request

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SecondOptionValue
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Second choice value for the condition

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SecondInternalRequestName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of corresponding internal request

Extension.name: sys_commAddCommunitiesEnabledFlag
Extension.initParam: This exit adds the attribute communities_enabled to the root element of result document. The value will be 'yes' if communities are enabled and 'no' if communities are not enabled.

Extension.name: sys_templateToVariantid
Extension.initParam: If a sys_template param exists and no sys_variantid exists, then the variant id is looked up and added as a parameter. Needed in casSupport in the PublicationUrl resource.

Extension.name: sys_DatabasePublisher
Extension.initParam: Use this exit for assemblers that produce output for database publishing. Produces an output document conforming to the sys_DatabasePublisher.dtd. The input document must conform to the markup.dtd.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: action
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Specifies the row action to take while publishing to a database. Valid entries are "n" for INSERT, "u" for UPDATE, "d" for DELETE or "r" for REPLACE. Optional, defaults to "r" for REPLACE.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: aliasmap
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The file name for the table and column aliasmap, optional.

Extension.name: sys_uiMakeActions
Extension.initParam:
This exit expands the context menu action list in the result XML document by building and adding the child actions recursively. This exit is specific to context menu building for the User Interface. Multiple internal requests are made to expand each child item to menu item. A sample actionlist XML is:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <ActionList name="Parent" url="" uicontextid="1" displayname="ROOT MENU" actionid="100" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> <ActionList name="Edit" url="" uicontextid="1" displayname="Edit" actionid="101" modeid="1"> <Action name="Edit_Content" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_action/checkoutedit.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Content" actionid="102" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> <Action name="Edit_Properties" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_action/checkoutedit.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Properties" actionid="103" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> <Action name="Flush_Cache" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_uiSupport/flushcache.html" uicontextid="1" displayname="Refresh Item" actionid="116" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> </ActionList> <ActionList name="View" url="" uicontextid="1" displayname="View" actionid="104" modeid="1"> <Action name="View_Content" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_ceSupport/contenteditorurls.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Content" actionid="105" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> <Action name="View_Properties" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_ceSupport/contenteditorurls.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Properties" actionid="106" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> <Action name="Flush_Cache" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_uiSupport/flushcache.html" uicontextid="1" displayname="Refresh Item" actionid="116" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> </ActionList> <ActionList name="Workflow" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_uiSupport/workflowactions.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Workflow" actionid="107" modeid="1"> <Action name="Workflow_Revisions" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_ceSupport/contenteditorurls.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Revisions" actionid="108" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> <Action name="Workflow_AuditTrail" url="http://10.10.10.156:9992/Rhythmyx/sys_ceSupport/contenteditorurls.xml" uicontextid="1" displayname="Audit Trail" actionid="110" modeid="1"> <Params> <Param name=""></Param> </Params> </Action> </ActionList> </ActionList>

Extension.name: sys_casInsertAsRelatedItem
Extension.initParam: This exit inserts a newly created item into related content of a specified parent item. This is used by the content editor for internal use only.

Extension.name: sys_emptyDoc
Extension.initParam: If the document is empty, it adds a root node by the name supplied as the first param.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: rootName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name to use for root node if there isn't one.

Extension.name: sys_idgen
Extension.initParam: Allocates a block of ids and sets them into the attributes of the generated doc.

Extension.name: sys_FlushAssemblerCache
Extension.initParam: Flushes assembler items from the cache using the provided key values. The keys may be omitted by setting an empty String as a value for that key. Omitting all keys will flush all assembler pages from the cache. If the contentid is omitted, revisionid must also be omitted.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: appname
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The application name

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The content id of item (numeric value)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revisionid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The revision id of item (numeric value)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: variantid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The variant id of item (numeric value)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sessionid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The session id for the current user's session (optional)

Extension.name: sys_FlushCache
Extension.initParam: Flushes all caches (Assembler, Resource, Folder and Hibernate caches) if the server is a Publishing Hub; otherwise do nothing.

Extension.name: sys_comAddDefaultCommunity
Extension.initParam: Adds default community id, default community name and default homepage url to the root element of the result document as attributes: sys_defaultcommunityid, sys_defaultcommunityname and sys_defaulthomepageurl, respectively. If fails to get the default values empty attributes are added.

Extension.name: sys_casAutoRelatedContent
Extension.initParam: Exit to add Automatic Related content to the slots in an Assembler.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: LinkURL
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the linkURL attribute. This must be an attribute of the root node.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: slotNameOverride
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Slot Name override (optional). Allows the caller to place the results in any slot.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: publishableTokens
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This optional parameter allows a caller to specify a comma delimited string with all publishable tokens. If not provided or empty, this defaults to 'y,i'.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revisionCorrectionTokens
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This optional parameter allows a caller to specify a comma delimited string of publishable tokens (such as i,x) for which the revision needs to be replaced with the last public revision. If not provided or empty, this defaults to 'i'.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: maxLinks
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This optional parameter allows a caller to limit the maximum number of linkUrl elements returned. The value must be a parsable integer. If not provided, < 0 or empty, all linkUrl elements will be returned.

Extension.name: sys_casCacheBySessionRule
Extension.initParam: Determines if the current request should be cached by session.

Extension.name: sys_FormatDateToLocale
Extension.initParam: Returns the date string localized to the supplied locale given the date and the output pattern. The first parameter is the dateobject(required) and the second parameter is the output pattern, if omitted a Java medium pattern with date and time is used. The third parameter is the locale to which the date needs to be transformed, if omitted user's locale will be used. The locale string must follow the XML syntax in which, the language, country and variant (if any), all in lower case are concatenated with hyphens. The country and language codes should follow the ISO standards

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateToBeLocalized
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: assumed to be server's default pattern(required).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: pattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Output pattern(required). If omitted, Java.Medium format pattern is used with date and time

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: LocaleString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Output Locale represented by language string such as 'en-us' or 'ja-jp'. User's locale is used if omitted.

Extension.name: sys_LocalizedTextLookup
Extension.initParam: Returns a localized text string given the language and keys. The first parameter is the language string (e.g. en-us or fr-fr etc.). Rest of the parameters make the lookup key. For example, if the second parameter is "psx", third is "contenteditor" , fourth is "301" (content type id) and the fifth is "Content Title", the lookup key produced will be "psx.contenteditor.301@Content Title". If the lookup key is not found in the language resource bundle, the key itself is returned or the last part of the key value depending on the second parameter. The locale string must follow the XML syntax in which, the language, country and variant (if any), all in lower case are concatenated with hyphens. The country and language codes should follow the ISO standards

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: LanguageString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Language string (e.g. en-us or fr-fr). Must be one of the supported by Rhythmyx (required), if not supplied user locale is used.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First part of the lookup key (required).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Second part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Third part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key4
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Fourth part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key5
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Fifth part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key6
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Sixth part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key7
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Seventh part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key8
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Eighth part

Extension.name: sys_FormatDateToUserLocale
Extension.initParam: Returns the date string localized to user's locale given the date and the output pattern. The first parameter is the date object(required) and the second parameter is the output pattern, if omitted a Java medium pattern with date and time is used.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateToBeLocalized
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: assumed to be server's default pattern(required).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: pattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Output pattern. If omitted, Java.Medium format pattern is used with date and time

Extension.name: sys_LocalizedTextLookupUser
Extension.initParam: Returns a localized text string given the keys. The parameters make the lookup key. For example, if the second parameter is "psx", third is "contenteditor" , fourth is "301" (content type id) and the fifth is "Content Title", the lookup key produced will be "psx.contenteditor.301@Content Title". If the lookup key is not found in the language resource bundle, the key itself is returned or the last part of the key value depending on the second parameter. The locale string must follow the XML syntax in which, the language, country and variant (if any), all in lower case are concatenated with hyphens. The country and language codes should follow the ISO standards

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First part of the lookup key (required).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Second part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Third part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key4
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Fourth part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key5
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Fifth part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key6
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Sixth part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key7
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Seventh part

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Key8
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Eighth part

Extension.name: sys_ConvertDateLocale
Extension.initParam: Generic UDF that returns the date string localized to the supplied locale given the date, input and output date patterns, and input locale. The first parameter is the date object(required), second is the input pattern, third input locale string, fourth output pattern and fifth is the output locale string. The locale strings must follow the XML syntax in which, the language, country and variant (if any), all in lower case are concatenated with hyphens. The country and language codes should follow the ISO standards

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: DateToBeLocalized
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: assumed to be server's default pattern(required).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: inputPattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Input pattern. If omitted, Java.Medium format pattern is used with date and time

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: inputLocaleString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Input Locale represented by language string such as 'en-us' or 'ja-jp'. System's default locale is used if omitted.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: outputPattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Output pattern. If omitted, Java.Medium format pattern is used with date and time

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: outputLocaleString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Output Locale represented by language string such as 'en-us' or 'ja-jp'. User's locale is used if omitted. If not supplied system default locale string is used

Extension.name: sys_TouchItemsFolderEffect
Extension.initParam: This effect is used to touch the items that are the dependents of a folder relationship. This effect is meant to be run in the contexts of RS_PRE_CONSTRUCTION, RS_PRE_DESTRUCTION and RS_PRE_UPDATE. It will only touch the dependents who are in public or quick-edit state. It "touches" the last modified date for the dependents and their Active Assembly relationship parents, so that they will be picked up by the next incremental publishing. For folder dependents, it touches all item descendents of the folders, but not the folder themselves.

Extension.name: sys_TouchParentFolderEffect
Extension.initParam: This effect is used to touch the items that are the dependents of a folder relationship. This effect is meant to be run in the contexts of RS_PRE_CONSTRUCTION, RS_PRE_DESTRUCTION and RS_PRE_UPDATE. It will only touch the dependents who are in public or quick-edit state. It "touches" the last modified date for the dependents and their Active Assembly relationship parents, so that they will be picked up by the next incremental publishing. For folder dependents, it touches all item descendents of the folders, but not the folder themselves.

Extension.name: sys_UnpublishMandatory
Extension.initParam: The current item cannot be transitioned to an unpublish (ContentValid != y or i) state from a public state unless the other end of this relationship is already unpublished. If the forceTransition parameter is yes, and a transition by the supplied name is found or a default transition to an unpublished state is present, the item will be transitioned with this item. If the other item cannot be put into an unpublished state, an exception is thrown and the item being processed is not allowed to transition. The effect will return immediately for any context except RS_PRE_WORKFLOW.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: forceTransition
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A boolean flag (either 'yes' or 'no' value) that controls whether the item at the other end of the relationship is forced to transition if it is possible. If 'no' and the item is already in a public state, the operation will fail.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ownerTransitionName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This is the internal name of the transition to use if the owner needs to be transitioned. If not supplied, the first transition with the 'default' property (in alpha order) is used.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: dependentTransitionName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This is the internal name of the transition to use if the dependent needs to be transitioned. If not supplied, the first transition with the 'default' property (in alpha order) is used.

Extension.name: sys_NotifyEffect
Extension.initParam: Notifies all assignees of the current item for the supplied parameters.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: workflowid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The workflow id for which to make the notification, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: stateid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The workflow state id for which to make the notification, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: transitionid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The transition id for which to make the notification, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: username
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The user name for which to make the notification, required.

Extension.name: sys_Promote
Extension.initParam: If the item being processed is entering a public (ContentValid = y) state for the first time, the item at the other end of the associated relationship will be 'replaced' by this one. A replacement is done by moving all non-cloneable relationships, except those that have a property named rs_skipPromotion whose value is 'yes', of which the original item is a dependent to the promoted item. The original item is checked out (thus producing a new revision) and all relationships except promotable are removed. The item is then checked back in. Finally, an attempt is made to transition the original item to a new state using the named transition or default transition. If this transition cannot be completed for any reason, it is not an error. The effect will return immediately for any context except RS_PRE_CONSTRUCTION or RS_PRE_WORKFLOW.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: transitionName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This is the internal name of the transition to use. If not supplied, the first transition with the 'default' property (in alpha order) is used.

Extension.name: sys_Validate
Extension.initParam: This effect immediately throws an exception if the context is construction (RS_PRE_CONSTRUCTION), otherwise, it returns immediately. It can be used to perform validation using conditionals. The conditions must be written such that they are the inverse of the desired validation. For example, to implement an item validation (request fails if the owner is not an item), this effect with the following conditional would be placed as the first effect in the relationship: PSXContentItemStatus/CONTENTSTATUS.OBJECTTYPE != 1 (Note that '1' is the id for objects of type of item.).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: errorMessage
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The text to return in the exception. This text can be internationalized.

Extension.name: sys_PublishMandatory
Extension.initParam: The current item cannot be transitioned to a public state (ContentValid = y or i) unless the item at the other end of this relationship is already in a public state. If the forceTransition parameter is yes, and a transition by the supplied name is found or a default transition to a public state is present, the item will be transitioned to the public state with this item. If the other item cannot be put into a public state, an exception is thrown and the item being processed is not allowed to transition. . The effect will return immediately for any context except RS_PRE_WORKFLOW.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: forceTransition
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A boolean flag (either 'yes' or 'no' value) that controls whether the item at the other end of the relationship is forced to transition if it is possible. If 'no' and the item is already in a public state, the operation will fail.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ownerTransitionName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This is the internal name of the transition to use if the owner needs to be transitioned. If not supplied, the first transition with the 'default' property (in alpha order) is used.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: dependentTransitionName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: This is the internal name of the transition to use if the dependent needs to be transitioned. If not supplied, the first transition with the 'default' property (in alpha order) is used.

Extension.name: sys_TranslationConstraint
Extension.initParam: Checks if the requested language for the current item already exists and throws an exception if so.

Extension.name: sys_OptionAccessorPersister
Extension.initParam: Used by the PSOptionManager for getting and setting Options for the Content Explorer.

Extension.name: sys_TranslationKeyValueLookup
Extension.initParam: Locates builds a list of keys and there corresponding values from the system.tmx file.

Extension.name: sys_ParamsToXml
Extension.initParam: This exit converts the an array of specified HTML parameters to an XML format and useful when a request comes with an array of HTML params. Each set of the specified parameters will be added as children of the element name specified by the first parameter. These elements in turn will be the children of the root element of the document For example: If the request has an array of sys_content and sys_revision parameters with a size of 2, the parameters to the exit will be 1. contentitem 2. sys_contentid 3. sys_revision and the result document generated after the exit will be: <rootElem> <contentitem> <sys_contentid>301</sys_contentid> <sys_revision>1</sys_revision> </contentitem> <contentitem> <sys_contentid>309</sys_contentid> <sys_revision>2</sys_revision> </contentitem> </rootElem> The exit itself is generic in that it takes any number parameters though it is specified as 3 now.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: unitElemName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the XML element name to put the parameters under

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Second parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Third parameter to extract

Extension.name: sys_ComputeAssignees
Extension.initParam: This UDF evaluates the assigned roles to a semi-colon separated list given the contentid of the item. The UDF takes the content id as the only first parameter.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ContentID
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: ContentId of the item, required

Extension.name: sys_ComputeCheckoutStatus
Extension.initParam: This UDF evaluates the checkout status to an image given the contentid of the item and image url options. Checkout status is evaluated based on the current checkout user name of the item which has the following possible values: 1. Nobody, when checkout user name is empty. 2. By someone else, when logged in user name does not match with checkout user name. 3. By me, when logged in user name matches with checkout user name. The UDF takes the content id as the first parameter and the rest are the image url options for each possible checkout status values above in that order.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ContentID
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: ContentId for the item in the workflow.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Nobody
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Not checked out to anybody

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SomeOneElse
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Checked out to somebody else

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: MySelf
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Checked out to me

Extension.name: sys_ComputeUserCheckoutStatus
Extension.initParam: This UDF evaluates the checkout status to an image given the name of the checkedout user and image url options. Checkout status is evaluated based on the current checkout user name of the item which has the following possible values: 1. Nobody, when checkout user name is empty. 2. By someone else, when logged in user name does not match with checkout user name. 3. By me, when logged in user name matches with checkout user name. The UDF takes the checked out username as the first parameter and the rest are the image url options for each possible checkout status values above in that order.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: CheckedOutUser
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the user that currently has the item checked out.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Nobody
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Not checked out to anybody

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SomeOneElse
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Checked out to somebody else

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: MySelf
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Checked out to me

Extension.name: sys_ComputeAssignmenType
Extension.initParam: This UDF evaluates the assignment type to an image given the contentid of the item and image url options. Assignment value (which is a number) is evaluated based on the current state of the workflow of the item. Currently supported assignment types are defined in the workflow documentation. The UDF takes the content id as the first parameter and the rest are the image url options for each possible assignment type in ascending order by value.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ContentID
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: ContentId of the item in the workflow

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ImageNone
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: User is not assignee

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ImageReader
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: User is Reader

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ImageAssignee
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: User is Assignee

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ImageAdmin
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: User is Administrator

Extension.name: sys_addNewItemToFolder
Extension.initParam: Adds newly created item to the folder.

Extension.name: sys_getItemTypeIconPaths
Extension.initParam:
Exit to get the icon paths for the supplied locators. Gets the input from the value of ItemLocators parameter from the request. It is a required parameter and returns unmodified result document if it is missing. Expects the value of the above parameter in the form of a string representation of XML consisting of PSXLocator elements as direct children of root element. The result document returned from the exit will be as per the following DTD
The returned resultDoc consists of an empty ItemIcons element if the input is not as expected by this exit.

Extension.name: sys_getAadItemTypeIconPaths
Extension.initParam: Gets the icon path for the items and sets it as iconPath attribute of item elements in the resultDoc. Expects the item elements as direct children of resultDoc with the following child elements "contentid", "revision", "contentcheckoutusername" and "tiprevision". If the item is checked out by the current user tip revision is used otherwise current revision is used to get the icon path. Unmodified resultDoc is returned if the resultDoc does not contain expected input. The iconPath attribute value may be empty if not specified on the content type corresponding to the item or if failed to obtain it.

Extension.name: sys_getRelationshipProps
Extension.initParam: Get the specified relationship properties in relProps.dtd format. It expecting the relationship id is specified by the sys_relationshipid in the request parameter.

Extension.name: sys_cleanupCrossSiteLiniks
Extension.initParam: This cleanup program is used to reset, log and optionally remove the incorrect or unnecessary sys_siteid and sys_folderid properties for all Active Assembly relationships for a specified site. It will put all log data into the trace file of the current application. The cleanup Exit can only be invoked one at a time for each Rhythmyx server. The trace must be enabled for the current application.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Target Site Id
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The id of the site which will be "cleaned" or "fixed" by the Exit. It must be an valid site id.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Relationship Category
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The category of the relationship, which is used to identify a parent folders under the target site when an item (a dependent of an 'Active Assembly' relationship) exists in more than one folders under the target site. It is assumed that the owner id of the relationship(s) is a folder under the original site and the dependent id is a folder under the target site.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Remove Site Id
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Determines whether to remove the sys_siteid property of the Active Assembly Relationship for all none cross site links, where the sys_siteid is the current site id. The sys_siteid property of the none cross site links will be removed if it is "true"; otherwise do nothing. Defaults to "true" if not specified.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Remove Folder Id
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Determines whether to remove the "unnecessary" sys_folderid property of the Active Assembly Relationship for all links, where the dependent item only exists in one folder under the "specified" site. The "unnecessary" sys_folderid property will be removed if this flag is "true"; otherwise do nothing. Note, the user may need to manually add the sys_folderid into the existing links afterwards if decided to put a dependent item in more than one folders under the same site. Defaults to "false" if not specified.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Preview mode
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Determines whether the execution of the Exit makes any changes in the database. It is "true" if no actual changes in the database; "false" if the execution of the Exit will make the changes in the database. Defaults to "false".

Extension.name: sys_CmsObjectNameLookup
Extension.initParam: This UDF is specifically designed to get the name of the CMS object given the Locator for the object. The locator is assumed to have not more than three parts. Note: This is very inefficient for the fact that it is a UDF which will be called per row in the result set and we make an internal request per row. Ideally, we need to cache all CMS name lookups during server initialization and avoid internal requests. In that this is a temporary feature.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: CmsObjectTypeName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Must match with the object lookup resource in sys_psxCms application

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyPart1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Required. First part of the object locator

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyPart2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Second part of the object locator

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyPart3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional.Third part of the object locator

Extension.name: sys_cxPurgeContent
Extension.initParam: This extension builds a content item list for deletion by the Rhythmyx update resource after deleting data from the content type specific tables by making internal requests to the content editor's purge resource. If the attempt to delete this data fails for any reason we add this item to skipped item list for deletion. The DTD for the document is: <!ELEMENT deleterows (row*, skipped) > <!ELEMENT row (#PCDATA) > <!ATTLIST row pkey CDATA #IMPLIED > <!ELEMENT skipped (row*) > This exit shall typically placed on an Rx update resource that deletes the rows from all system tables. The XML element pkey must be mapped to the primary key in the backed table(s).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: keyParameterName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the html parameter that has the key parameter value(s)

Extension.name: sys_loadChildData
Extension.initParam: Adds child data by replacing the specified element with the results of the query supplied by the specified attribute.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: baseElement
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the element that will contain the child data

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: childElement
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the child element of the base element that will be replaced with the results of the query

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: queryAttribute
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the attribute of the child element that specifies the query to execute

Extension.name: sys_CreateTranslations
Extension.initParam: This extension translates given array of items into supplied locale. It needs corresponding array of revisions and community id and workflow id. Gets the internal request for the content type url with required paramers for the translation and then makes an internal request to execute the url. Builds the result document with the status of translations for each content item.

Extension.name: sys_psxAddServerConfigParams
Extension.initParam: This extension adds the server configuration parameters to the result document. All parameters are added as last child elements of the specified element by name via first parameter. Element name is optional and if not specified the root element of the result document is considered.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: elemName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the element to which all config params are addes as child elements. If more than one elements are present in the document, the first one (optional)is taken . If not specified root element of the result document is considered.

Extension.name: sys_addAllowableWorkflowsForContentType
Extension.initParam: This extension determines the allowable workflows for one or more content types. As a pre exit, it will determine the union of the allowed workflows for each supplied content type id and store the workflow ids in the specified parameter. As a post-exit it will append the allowed workflow information to each content type specified in the input document. It expects the input doc as per the following DTD. <!ELEMENT ContentTypes (ContentType*) > <!ELEMENT ContentType (#PCDATA) > <!ATTLIST ContentType contenttypeid CDATA #IMPLIED > The allowable workflows will be added as per the following DTD to the ContentTypes element. <!ELEMENT workflows (workflow*) > <!ATTLIST Workflow workflowid CDATA #IMPLIED >

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ContentTypeId
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The content type id(s) either as a String or a non-empty List of String objects - optional when used as a pre-exit, ignored otherwise

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: OutParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the parameter in which the resulting workflow ids are to be stored as a List of String objects - required when used as a pre-exit, ignored otherwise.

Extension.name: sys_checkOutSlotItem
Extension.initParam: Checks out a slot a item before expanding it. If the item is already checked out by someone else or assignment type less than assignee, then hides slots for that item. If fails to check out then hides the slots.

Extension.name: sys_casPublishableContent
Extension.initParam: Tests if the addressed content is publishable or not.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: publishableTokens
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of tokens that represent publishable content, may be NULL or empty in which case the defaults 'y,i' are used.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sys_contentid
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The content id of the item to test, may be NULL in which case the content id of the supplied request is used. If no valid content id is supplied, an exception is thrown.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sys_revision
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The revision of the item to test, may be NULL in which case the current revision is used.

Extension.name: sys_IncrementalContentFilter
Extension.initParam: This is a Rhythmyx Post-Exit which will filter out content items from a content list which have already been published or unpublished.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: queryrequest
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the internal request for site item lookup.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: switchparameter
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (Optional) Name of the HTML parameter for switching the filter on and off.

Extension.name: sys_NullIf
Extension.initParam: Sets the specified request parameters to 'null' if their value matches the compareTo value. (case-sensitive comparison).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: compareTo
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: value that will be converted to null

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: p1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of parameter to check

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: p2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of parameter to check

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: p3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of parameter to check

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: p4
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of parameter to check

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: p5
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: name of parameter to check

Extension.name: sys_ExtractHtmlParamsFromInputDoc
Extension.initParam: This exit extracts named parameters from the standard HTML parameter input document to HTML parameters with same names into the request. The DTD for the input XMLdocument must be the following: <!ELEMENT HtmlParams ANY> The root element HtmlParams can have one or more child elements that are name value pairs. The element name will be the parameter name and the value of the element is the value of the parameter. There can be multiple elements with the same name so that multi-valued HTML parameters are supported. Exit supports a way of specifying to extract the value of a multi-valued parameter suitable for IN clause of a SQL query. Also, we can specify if the parameter values should been closed in quotes. The first parameter for this exit is flag that specifies if the extracted value has to be suitable for IN clause of SQL query. Default is 'n' ("no"). The second parameter for this exit is flag that specifies if each value of the parameter in the extracted value string needs to be in quotes. Default is 'y' ("yes"). Rest of the parameters for the exit are the names of the HTML parameters to be extracted out of the input document.The exit itself is generic in that it takes any number of parameters though it is specified as 8 now (which means 0 total parameters for the exit).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: isForInClause
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: 'y' if the extraction is for IN clause of SQL statement, default is 'n'

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: encloseInQuotes
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: 'y' if the individual value of the parameter needs to be enclosed in quotes, default is 'y'

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName4
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName5
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName6
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName7
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName8
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the parameter to extract

Extension.name: sys_MakeIntRequest
Extension.initParam: Makes an internal request to the supplied Rhythmyx resource and returns the result document. If no handler was found for the supplied resource, NULL will be returned.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: resource
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The Rhythmyx resource to which to make an internal request, required. Specifies the application and page of the dataset to which the internal request is to be made. May be as little as "appName/pageName" or as much as "http://127.0.0.1:9992/Rhythmyx/AppTest/nov.xml?alpha=bravo&test=5".

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: stylesheet
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the stylesheet to be applied to the request result document, optional. The stylesheet must be stored in a rhythmyx application. If stored in the current application, just the file name is needed (e.g. transform.xsl). For other applications use relative path (e.g. ../sys_resources/stylesheets/transform.xsl).

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: inheritParams
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A flag to specify whether or not to inherit the original request parameters for the internal request. Optional, defaults to 'yes' if not supplied. All case insensitive values of 'yes' evaluate to true.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName0
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Request parameter name, optional. Parameter parsing will be stopped at the first NULL or empty parameter name.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramValue0
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Request parameter value, optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Request parameter name, optional. Parameter parsing will be stopped at the first NULL or empty parameter name.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramValue1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Request parameter value, optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Request parameter name, optional. Parameter parsing will be stopped at the first NULL or empty parameter name.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramValue2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Request parameter value, optional.

Extension.name: sys_AddServerProperties
Extension.initParam: This is a generic exit that adds a specified list of properties from server.properties file as attributes to the root element of the result document. The list of properties required is specified as parameters to the exit.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: PropertyName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the server property. Exit adds an attribute with the same name and value from the server.properties file will be added to the root element of the resulting document

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: PropertyName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the server property. Exit adds an attribute with the same name and value from the server.properties file will be added to the root element of the resulting document

Extension.name: sys_AddIsManagedNavUsed
Extension.initParam: This exit adds isManagedNavUsed=yes attribute to the root element of the result document if the managed navigation is configured (or the managed navigation properties file exists) in the server.

Extension.name: sys_AddPluginProperties
Extension.initParam: The purpose of the exit is to choose the appropriate plug-in from the server configuration settings based on the client OS and Browser and add the plug-in related attributes to the root element of the XML document.

Extension.name: sys_RhythmyxRoot
Extension.initParam: Constructs the rhythmyx root url out of the supplied request and returns it as String, for example 'http://localhost:9992/Rhythmyx'.

Extension.name: sys_casCreatePortalPropertyList
Extension.initParam: Create a given element containing a series of defined properties. Each property can be a string, an integer, a date or a list of string values. For dates and lists the pattern argument is used. For lists it is used to tokenize the given value as the delimiters to java.utils.StringTokenizer. For dates it specifies the format of the date to the publisher.

PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the parent element to create

PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The property name

PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The property type

Extension.initParam: Automatically extracts Image height and width when uploaded using a sys_file control, in addition to the parameters extraction by sys_FileInfo Exit.
