Extension.name: sys_InlineImageSizeExtractor
Extension.initParam: The purpose of this exit is to add image height and width as attributes to the root of result document. This exit expects urlstring and inlinetype attributes on the root element of the result document. If the value of inlinetype attribute is not image, no modification takes place, the result document will be returned as is. If the urlstring produces a binary image then its height and width will be added as attributes to the root element of the result document otherwise no modification takes place.

Extension.name: sys_TextToXml
Extension.initParam: Parses the supplied XML fragment and returns an XML Document.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: RootName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the root element to create. The parsed Xml fragment is appended as a child of this root element. Required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: XmlFragment
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: String value containing a single well formed Xml element. Required.

Extension.name: sys_cloneOverrideField
Extension.initParam:
This is a generic UDF that can be used to compute field value to override when cloning. The scheme basically involves executing a Rhythmyx URL that generates an XML document with predefined DTD. Then the value is located based on the name of the element supplied. The parameter description is as follows:
First parameter is the name of the Rhythmyx resource that generates the field value to be overridden. This has a syntax of ../rxApp/resource.xml.
Second parameter is the exact name of the element that contains the child node as the value of the field to override. If there are more than one such elements, only the first one is considered
Rest of the parameters are the parameter name-value pairs that are required for the resource to generate the field value.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Url
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Rhythmyx resource url that produces the XML document of field values

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FieldElemName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the child element in the document that has the field value as text child node

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ParamName1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First parameter name

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ParamValue1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: First parameter value

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ParamName2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Second parameter name

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ParamValue2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Second parameter value

Extension.name: sys_AttachTranslatedFolder
Extension.initParam: This effect is typically attached to relationships of category translation. The net result of this effect is: The newly translated object (item or folder) will be attached to its translation parent's folder parent's translation matching the locale of the new translation. If the folder parent does not have a translation with a matching locale, the new object will be attached to the folder parent itself. If the translation parent is not attached to any folder then the new translation will not be attached to any folder. This effect will be active for the following situations only: 1. The execution context is RS_PRE_CONSTRUCTION. 2. The origination relationship and the current relationship both are of category translation. 3. The originating relationship's owner is a folder.

Extension.name: sys_createTranslations
Extension.initParam: Workflow action that creates all non existing translations of the current item. Makes use of a configuration file that must be located under rxconfig/I18n with name sys_createTranslations.properties. This file can contain the relationship type name and the locale list to exclude to create translations/

Extension.name: sys_isCloneExists
Extension.initParam: Effect to check if a clone already exists for an item based on some implementer defined rules for a relationship type.

Extension.name: sys_CloneTitle
Extension.initParam:
This UDF formats a content item title for a new clone. It queries CMS relationships in order to determine how many clones already exist of an original item / owner, then, given java MessageFormat string with or without insertion items and one or more dynamic parameters, formats the final title for a new cloned item. 
 
 Param1: (required) MessageFormat string, ie: [{0}]Copy $clone_count of {1}    where:    
    {0} will be replaced by a replacement value supplied to this UDF    in a Param2, which for example could be a sys_lang html param.    
     $clone_count is a special keyword, if present then this UDF will    replace it with a number that represents a number of clones,    or with an empty string if there are no clones yet (creating a first clone).    
    {1} will be replaced by a replacement value supplied to this UDF    in a Param3, which for example could be a sys_title html param.    
    Finally the result for the above example could look like this:    [fr-fr]Copy of myContent 
 Param2: (required if {0} is used) any replacement value that will be    inserted into insert item {0}. 
 Param3: (required if {1} is used) any replacement value that will be    inserted into insert item {1}. 
 etc.
Note: if the number of {inserts} in the MessageFormat string does not match the number of parameters (after format) given to this UDF, then it will throw the PSConversionException.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Pattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Pattern for the new title that could have insertion items like {0}, {1} etc.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: InserttionItem0
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: replaces {0} in the pattern above

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: InserttionItem1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: replaces {1} in the pattern above

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: InserttionItem2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: replaces {2} in the pattern above

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: InserttionItem3
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: replaces {3} in the pattern above

Extension.name: sys_textExtraction
Extension.initParam: Extracts a file's contents as either text or HTML.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Source
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Contains a reference to the file containing the data to extract. If the value of this parameter is a File object, it is used directly, otherwise toString() is called on the value of this parameter and the result is used as a path to construct the File object. This is generally populated using a file upload control from the html form. Required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: OutputParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The request parameter in which the extracted text will be stored. This will generally be the submitName of another content editor field. Required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: FileTypeParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the request parameter in which the file type identified for use in the extraction will be stored as text. This enables the caller to retrieve the file type and store it in another editor field. Optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ErrorMessageParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the request parameter in which any error messages are to be stored as text. If not supplied, the extension will throw exceptions for any errors encountered. If supplied, any error encountered will be written to this parameter, and the exit will silently return. In this case the specified Output parameter value will be unmodified (unless that name is passed as to this parameter as well), and the file type parameter may or may not be modified. Optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: OutputFormat
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Two output formats are supported, TEXT and HTML. TEXT is the plain text output, possibly with some white space formatting (depending on the file type). HTML returns the text formatted as closely as possible to the original using HTML tags. If not supplied, defaults to TEXT. Optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: UseLinefeed
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Indicates if line endings should be returned as carriage returns or converted to linefeeds. Supply Y (case-insensitive) to convert to linefeeds. Any other value (or if omitted) indicates that carriage returns are to be used. Ignored if output format is HTML. Optional

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: HTMLTemplate
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional override for template to use when extracting content as HTML. Ignored if output format is to be TEXT. To use a template other than the default, it must be placed on the server hosting the search engine (which may not be hosting the Rx server). This parameter value must specify a valid file path to that template file, and it must be relative to the value specified for INSTALL_DIR, which is the value provided when running the installer (defaults to rxroot/sys_search/rware). toString() is called on the parameter value to obtain the path. If not supplied, the system default template is used.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: OutputEncoding
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Specifies encoding to use for output character set. If not specified, then WINDOWS-1252 is used for TEXT, UTF-8 for HTML. Specifying an unsupported encoding will produce an error. If the source file uses characters outside of that character set this may result in loss of data. Currently only the following encodings may be specified: Shift_JIS (Japanese), EUC_KR (Korean), GB2312 (Simple Chinese), Big5 (Traditional Chinese)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: PDFConversion
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A value to indicate how the extraction should be performed if the file type is determined to be a PDF (it is ignored otherwise). There are two allowed values, case-insensitive: SINGLE - does not handle multi-byte characters in the source data, creates output using system default character set, does handle multiple columns in the source data. Any output format specified is ignored and TEXT is used. MULTI - does handle multi-byte characters in the source data, creates output using the specified encoding (if supplied), does not handle multiple columns in the source data. Output format may be specified as TEXT or HTML. If not supplied, defaults to SINGLE.

Extension.name: sys_textExtractor
Extension.initParam: Extracts a file's contents as text.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Source
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the field that contains the data to be converted.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: OutputParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The request parameter in which the extracted text will be stored. This will generally be the submitName of another content editor field. Required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ErrorMessageParam
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the request parameter in which any error messages are to be stored as text. If not supplied, the extension will throw exceptions for any errors encountered. If supplied, any error encountered will be written to this parameter, and the exit will silently return. In this case the specified Output parameter value will be unmodified (unless the value passed to parameter OutputParam is passed to this parameter as well). Optional.

Extension.name: sys_getModifiedInlineItems
Extension.initParam: This exit is specifically written to help processing inline links with promotable versions in Word OCX control. Expects 3 html parameters in the request, viz. "sys_contentid", "sys_revision" and "inlinecontentids". The first two parameters refer to the parent content item that has the inline links. The third parameter is a semi-colon separated list of contentids of the inline items for the parent item. The Word control requests the result document produced by this exit while processing inline links for an item and replaces the contentids and revisions appropriately.

Extension.name: sys_getInlineVariantBody
Extension.initParam: Used by inline variant search to extract the inline variant body.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: tokenizeScriptTags
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: If "true" then the script start and end tags will be replaced by placeholder tokens that will be replaced by javascript.

Extension.name: sys_generateSearchResults
Extension.initParam: This exit is used to produce search results for HTML search conforming to the SearchResults.dtd.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: browserWindowFeatures
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: An optional parameter to specify the browser window features with which the content url's are produced. The exit uses the default browser window features if not specified.

Extension.name: sys_generateSearchQuery
Extension.initParam: Generates the xml to render the html search query page

Extension.name: sys_ConvertCustomSearchOperator
Extension.initParam: Converts the custom search operator from what the applet will send to the proper backend SQL operator. Can also convert the operator and value(s) sent to the appropriate sql where clause syntax.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: operatorParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The html parameter name containing the operator to convert. If a value parameter name is not also supplied by the valueParamName parameter, then the operator value is converted and assigned to the html parameter with that name. Only text operators are supported in this case. If a value parameter name is also supplied, the behavior is different and this html parameter is not modified. See the valueParamName parameter for details. Required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: valueParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The html parameter name containing the value(s) to convert. If supplied, then the operator and value(s) are used to construct a SQL fragment that can be used as a where clause. The resulting value is stored in the parameter name specified by the sqlFragmentParamName. If the specified parameter does not contain a value, then no action is taken. Optional.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sqlFragmentParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The parameter name to use to store the resulting sql fragment. Required only if the value parameter is supplied.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: backendColumnName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Backend column name to use in the SQL fragment. Required only if valueParamName is supplied.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: backendColumnDataType
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Datatype of backend column, must be TEXT, NUMBER, or DATE, used to format values in the sql query. Optional, defaults to TEXT.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: connectorOperator
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Operator to prepend onto the SQL fragment (e.g. AND or OR). If not supplied, no operator value is prepended. Ignored if the valueParamName parameter is not supplied, or if that parameter does not supply a value.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: dateFormatString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Format to use if the backend column type is DATE. Supplied values must conform to those accepted by java.text.SimpleDateFormat. Optional, defaults to "yyyy-MM-dd".

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: useHtmlParamDoc
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Flag to get HTML param values directly from the doc sent by the applet, or to look for HTML params in the request context. 'y' to get them from the doc, 'n' to get them from the request context. If 'y', then and inputdoc conforming to the format expected by PSHtmlParamDocument.fromXml(Element) must be found in the request context. Optional, defaults to 'y'.

Extension.name: sys_AddCloneToFolder
Extension.initParam:
This Effect associates a new clone of a Content Item with the Folder or Folders in which the Owner in the Relationship resides. The Effect runs when:
The context is Relationship creation; The request includes the HTML parameter sys_folderid, with a value that is not null and not empty (if the request includes multiple values for this parameter, the clone will be added to each specified Folder); and The Relationship that is being processed is the Relationship that originally created the clone. (This requirement ensures that Effect will only be processed once in the life of the Relationship.)
This Effect is assigned to Relationships that allow users to create clones directly in the Content Explorer interface, such as the New Copy and Promotable Version Relationships.
Note that the Effect does not check whether the clone is already associated with any of the specified Folders.

Extension.name: sys_queryExtensions
Extension.initParam: Creates a document that consists of a list of Rhythmyx exits. The parameters limit the list to relevant extensions.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: rootElementName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The root element name of the output document. This is required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: extensionNamePattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A pattern to match against the exit name. Use % to match an arbitrary count of characters, _ to match a single character

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: interfaceNamePattern
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A pattern to match against the Java interface name. Use % to match an arbitrary count of characters, _ to match a single character

Extension.name: sys_PublishContent
Extension.initParam: This exit allows an edition to be run on a workflow transition.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: editionId
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Manual Edition to publish

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: assemblyVariant
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Variant that generates the actual data

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: previewVariant
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Variant that user clicks on for preview

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: support application
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (Optional) Application that is run to manipulate manual edition items. Defaults to rx_pubPreviewEdition

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: query resource
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (Optional) Query resource in the support application. Defaults to queryEdition

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: update resource
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (Optional) Update resource in the support application. Defaults to updateEdition

Extension.name: sys_uiFilterActionList
Extension.initParam: Filters the action information for a specific content item. The content item is read from the request.

Extension.name: sys_casAuthtypeDispatcher
Extension.initParam: Exit to dispatch to appropriate authtype implementation resource based on the authtype registrations in the authtypes.properties files and merge the result documents appropriately

Extension.name: sys_casSiteFolderAuthTypeFilter
Extension.initParam: Site Folder Publishing facilitates publishing of Content Items in a Content Explorer Site Folder tree to an identical folder tree on a delivery site or multiple delivery sites. As only the site folder items get published in the site folder publishing the related content links need to be filtered. This exit is meant for casSupport resources and resources that generate auto related content. When it is used on auto related content resources this exits should be placed after sys_casAutoRelatedContent exit. The exit filters the link url elements based on the following criteria. Site based filtering: If link url consists of sys_siteid attribute then checks whether a site with this id exists in RXSITES table or not. If not removes that link url. If siteid attribute does not exist then the sys_originalsiteid parameter from the request will be used if that does not exist then sys_siteid from the request will be used for filtering. Folder based filtering: If link url consists of sys_folderid attribute then checks whether the folder exists or not. If not removes that link url. Then checks whether the folder exists in above site or not. If not removes the link. Then checks whether the item exists in the above folder or not. If not removes the link. Variant based filtering. If the variant is a page variant then checks whether it is a publishable variant or not. If not removes the link.

Extension.name: sys_casGetSiteBaseUrl
Extension.initParam:
UDF to get the base URL string for a given site.
The site can be specified as the first parameter to the UDF which is the siteid for which the base URL is being requested. If not specified, it will be taken from the request context as parameter. This, if supplied must be a valid siteid from the system.
The second parameter, which is optional can be used to specify to modify the base URL for if the context is for an intra-site. The context is treated as intra-site if the originating siteid is not null or empty and matches with the current siteid. The originating siteid as always read from the request as the html parameter sys_originalsiteid. The value should be a string "yes" to modify the URL (case insensitive) and any other value or no value is treated as "no". If the value is "yes", the URL string will modified to chop the protocol, host and port and return only the part after those. If the final result is "/" an empty string is returned.
If the current siteid is not supplied and does not exist in the request, the base URL will be returned as an empty string without any processing.
An internal request is executed to lookup the site attributes.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: SiteId
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (Optional) SiteId of the site to get the Base URL. If not specified, it will be taken from the request context as sys_siteid parameter.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: modifyForIntraSite
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (Optional) Can be used to specify to modify the base URL for if the context is for an intra-site. Default is "yes" any other value or no value is treated as "no".

Extension.name: sys_casFixRelatedUrlForPublicRevision
Extension.initParam:
This exit is intended to correct the related link URLs in assembly XML document for last public revision and typically goes onto an authtype implementation resource, for example, sys_casSupport/casSupport_1 or any custom authtype resource that needs corrections for the last public revision.It takes two optional parameters:
1. Name of the element in the result XML document whose value represents of the link URL to be corrected for last public revision. If the name specified starts with "@", then the link URL is taken from any element that has an attribute with that name. Default is "linkurl".
2. A flag ("yes" or "no" or "true" or "false") to instruct whether the link element has to be removed from the document if the related item never went to public.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: linkUrlElementOrAttribute
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the element or attribute holding the link URL. Default is "linkurl"

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: removeLinkIfNeverPublic
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Specify "no" or "false" to keep the link element even if the item never went to a public state. Default is "yes" which will remove the link element if the item never went to a public state.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentValidString
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. String which is a comma separated list of content valid flags, (e.g. i,x) for revision correction. Default is "i"

Extension.name: sys_SplitDateToParams
Extension.initParam: Splits supplied date into its components and sets as request parameters with specified parameter names.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sourceDate
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Source date. Typically string. If other than string object is supplied a toString() will be performed and then parsed as date.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: yearParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the html parameter to set the year of the date parsed. If not specified, year will not be set into the request parameters.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: monthParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the html parameter to set the month of the date parsed. The month will be 1 based, e.g. 1 for January 2 for February etc. If not specified, month will not be set into the request parameters.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: dateParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Optional. Name of the html parameter to set the date of the date parsed. The date will be 1 based, e.g. 1 for 1st day of the month 2 for 2nd day of the month etc. If not specified, date will not be set into the request parameters.

Extension.name: sys_WepFixImages
Extension.initParam: Examines the incoming HTML doc, looks for all the 'img' tags, if there is no width and height attribute then grabs the image from 'src', calculates actual image size and then sets width, height, rxwidth and rxheight on the img tag.

Extension.name: percCategoryTreeXml
Extension.initParam: This exit is to be used retrieve a category tree in the XML format that the tree control expects.

Extension.name: sys_catalogGlobalTemplates
Extension.initParam: This exit catalogs the names of all currently defined global templates. It does not expect any parameter.

Extension.name: sys_cloneVariants
Extension.initParam: This exit adds all the slots and sites associated with the source variant to the new variant clone. If the parameter clonesourceid is not provided the exit does nothing. This exit also needs the newly created variant id in the form of HTML parameter named "variantid" if it is missing, the exit skips copying variant relations.

Extension.name: sys_cloneCommunity
Extension.initParam: This exit is used to clone communities. If the HTML parameter sourcecloneid is supplied, this exit gets all Content Types, Workflows, Components, Variants, Sites that are related to the source community and adds them to the new community clone. If that parameter is not found, this exit does nothing. This exit also needs the newly created community id in the form of HTML parameter named "communityid" if it is missing, the exit skips copying community relations. If roleid HTML parameter exists then it adds that role to the new community, if rolename exists instead of roleid then it creates a new role with that name and newly created roleid will be added to the community. If there are any errors while creating the role it writes to the trace and user has to create the role in Admin client and then add that role to the new community manually.

Extension.name: sys_cloneWorkflow
Extension.initParam: This exit clones children of the source workflow (states, roles, transitions etc.) and adds them to the new workflow clone. If the parameter "clonesourceid" is not provided the exit does nothing. The workflow cloning deep clones its children. This exit also needs the newly created workflow id in the form of HTML parameter named "workflowid" if it is missing, the exit skips creating workflow child items such as states, roles etc.

Extension.name: sys_OverrideLiteral
Extension.initParam: This UDF converts the supplied 'default' parameter to a String and returns that or the value supplied through the request parameter named as specified with the parameter 'overrideParameterName'. The override request parameter is removed once it was consumed.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: default
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The default object which will be returned as String, required.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: overrideParameterName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The HTML parameter name which allows an override of the default value, optional.

Extension.name: sys_AddVariantSiteFolder
Extension.initParam:
This extension is active only if the request has html parameter "slotId" and has a non-empty value. It goes through each row in the search results for three columns, namely:
1. sys_contenttypeid 2. sys_variantid 3. sys_siteid 4. sys_folderid
sys_contenttypeid column is a required column and hence will be present in each row. The display value for this column will be replaced with the content type name.
If sys_variantid exists in the search result row as one of the columns, then the row is cloned as many times as the number of variants that the item (row) has and those variants allowed for the slot. The internal and display values for "sys_variantid" column in each such row will then be set appropriately.
If sys_sited column exists in a row, the row is cloned to have one row per site the item is in. For example, if the item in the row exists in "Internet" and "Internet Mirror", that row becomes two rows with ever column unchanged except for sys_siteid column. This column gets a internal value and display value for each site the item exists.
If sys_folderid column exists in a row, the row is cloned to have one row per each site folder the item exists in. The internal and display names for sys_folderid column in each row will be set appropriately.
Finally, rows are filtered to remove a row if a variant is not allowed for a site.

Extension.name: sys_cleanFolderSearchResults
Extension.initParam: This exit is meant to be added to the search results processor. The function of this exit is to clean up unnecessary result field values for folders by setting the values of these fields to an empty value. This exit should run after any other search result processing exit that may modify search result values.

Extension.name: sys_AddThumbnailURL
Extension.initParam: This exit is meant to be added to the search results processor. The function of this exit is to generate the preview url to display the thumbnail. The variant to be used for each contenttype is defined in sys_AddThumbnailURL.properties located in rxconfig\Server.

Extension.name: sys_modifySiteDefs
Extension.initParam: This is a dummy resource where all work is done in a post exit. 2 parameters are expected: sys_originalPath and sys_newPath. All sites (RXSITES) are scanned and any folder path that matches original is updated to match the new path. The result doc indicates success or failure and includes error info on failure (if success is false). The result doc has the following DTD: <!ELEMENT ModifySiteDefsResults (Error?)> <!ATTLIST ModifySiteDefsResults success (true|false) #REQUIRED > <!ELEMENT Error (Message, StackTrace)> <!ELEMENT Message (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT StackTrace (#PCDATA)>

Extension.name: sys_copySiteDef
Extension.initParam: This is a dummy resource where all work is done in a post exit. 3 parameters are expected: sys_originalSiteName, sys_newSiteName and sys_newFolderPath. A search is done looking for a site whose name matches the original supplied. Once found, this site is copied and the site name and folder path are set from the supplied values before saving the copy. The result doc indicates success or failure and includes error info on failure (if success is false). The result doc has the following DTD: <!ELEMENT CopySiteDefResults (Error?)> <!ATTLIST CopySiteDefResults success (true|false) #REQUIRED > <!ELEMENT Error (Message, StackTrace)> <!ELEMENT Message (#PCDATA)> <!ELEMENT StackTrace (#PCDATA)>

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: max
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) The maximum value can be either a java.lang.Number or a java.lang.String which will be converted to a Double

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: includemax
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) If true then the range includes the maximum value. The boolean value can be either a java.lang.Boolean or a java.lang.String which will be converted to a boolean value (true, yes or t will convert to true), defaults to false

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: max

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: min

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: includemmin
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) If true then the range includes the minimum value. The boolean value can be either a java.lang.Boolean or a java.lang.String which will be converted to a boolean value (true, yes or t will convert to true), defaults to false

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: max
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) The maximum value can be either a java.util.Date or a java.lang.String which will be converted to a date

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: includemax
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (optional) If true then the range includes the maximum value. The boolean value can be either a java.lang.Boolean or a java.lang.String which will be converted to a boolean value (true, yes or t will convert to true), defaults to false

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Field name

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: value
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The value to be translated. Use single html field/fieldname to get the value.

Extension.name: sys_NormalizeDate
Extension.initParam: Input translation to read a date using a specified format. The output format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS, if a time component is present, otherwise it is yyyy-MM-dd. Both formats are guaranteed to be parseable by the server. The formats supported by Java's SimpleDateFormat are supported by this method. A summary follows. y - year M - month of year d - day of month H - hour of day m - minute of hour s - second of minute S - fractions of a second e.g. yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS, MM-dd-yyyy

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: value
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The value to be translated

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: format
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A simple date format used to parse the incoming date

Extension.name: sys_FormatDate
Extension.initParam: Output translation to format a date into a specified format. The formats supported by Java's SimpleDateFormat are supported by this method. A summary follows. y - year M - month of year d - day of month H - hour of day m - minute of hour s - second of minute S - fractions of a second e.g. yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS, MM-dd-yyyy

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: value
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The value to be translated

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: format
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A simple date format used to format the date

Extension.name: sys_CalculateCompareRevision
Extension.initParam: Calculate the right revision to use in the compare panel. If there are two different content ids then the 2nd item revision value is returned without processing. If the second item revision is supplied, then it is returned without processing. If the second item revision is not supplied, and the two content ids match, or the second content id is not supplied, then the first revision is returned less 1. If the first revision is 1 then that is returned instead.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The first content id

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: contentid2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The second content id, optional

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revision1
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The first revision supplied

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: revision2
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The second revision supplied, optional

Extension.name: sys_filterByFolderPaths
Extension.initParam: Filters content by the given folder or folders. The folders are passed via the sys_folderPaths parameter separated by semicolon.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: sys_folderPaths
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: One or more paths separated by semicolon, e.g. “//Sites/Enterprise Investments;//Sites/Corporate Investments”. Items contained in the given folders or subfolders of the specified folders pass. The paths may contain one or more wildcards (%) which have the same semantics as in SQL. If the path contains none then it is an exact match. To match a folder and its descendents you will need to include it twice, e.g. for the folder path starting “//sites/myco” you would need the path “//sites/myco;//sites/myco/%”.

PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The page revision. (Required)

Extension.name: sys_SetArrayHtmlParameter
Extension.initParam: Sets a HTML Parameter to the request with an array list of values. Makes an internal request to the provided resource and gets the values from provided element name. The values can me limited by MaxNumber exit parameter or request parameter. The latter takes higher precedence.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: paramName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the HTML parameter. (required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: resourceName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Makes a request to Rhythmyx resource with this name. It should be app/resource.(required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: elementName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the element from which the values will be taken. (required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: maxNumber
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The list size will be limited to this number or to the size of elements, which ever is smaller. If provided, the value must be an Integer. This will be overridden by the HTML parameter in the request (if exists). If no value is provided for this and no HTML parameter is specified then all element values will be added. One can control first or last n number of items by building the rhythmyx request with a definite sort order(optional)

Extension.name: sys_SearchCommunityHandler
Extension.initParam: Removes permission properties from a search object and creates acl entries for the search object instead.

Extension.name: sys_createCommunityAcl
Extension.initParam: This extension will create an ACL that gives runtime visibility to the user's current community and design axis to the Default entry. It was designed to be added to the app that creates a new object that needs community acls, not for general use.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: objectIdParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the HTML parameter, by which the objectid can be fetched.(required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: objectType
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: PSTypeEnum value of the object.

Extension.name: sys_deleteObjectAcl
Extension.initParam: This extension will permanently delete the ACL identified by the objectname parameter. It was designed to be added to the app that deletes object acls, not for general use.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: objectIdParamName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the HTML parameter, by which the object id can be fetched.(required)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: objectType
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: PSTypeEnum value of the object.(required)

Extension.name: sys_validateFile
Extension.initParam: Checks if the supplied file is not empty on the client or not.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: source
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The field which holds the file to be checked, may be null or empty.

Extension.name: sys_editionCommandTask
Extension.initParam: Edition task to run a command before or after an edition is run. The following is a list of substitution variables for use in the command: $editionName (String type, Edition name) $siteName (String type, Site name) $sitePublishingPath (String type, Site publishing path) $editionStartTime (String type, the start time of the Edition run. It is in the format of yyyyMMdd'T'HHmmssSSS) $editionEndTime (String type, the end time of the Edition run. It is in the format of yyyyMMdd'T'HHmmssSSS) $sitePublishedUrl (String type, the base URL of the published site) $failureCount (String type, the number of failures in this publishing run) $successCount (String type, the number of successfully published pages)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: command
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The command to run, use substitution variables like ${editionName} to customize the behavior of the command. Defined variables include editionName, siteName, sitePublishingPath, editionStartTime, editionEndTime(*), sitePublishedUrl, successCount(*) and failureCount(*). Note that those marked with (*) are only valid for a post edition task.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: timeOut
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The maximum time in seconds to wait for the command to finish, or wait indefinite if it is zero. The task fails if the exit code of the command is non-zero or if the command has not finished in time. If it is not specified, the command will run asynchronously and its exit code will be ignored.

Extension.name: sys_editionRunnerTask
Extension.initParam: Edition task to asynchronously invoke another edition. It is typically used in a post edition task to chain another edition

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: Edition
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the edition you want to publish.

Extension.name: perc_AntEditionTask
Extension.initParam: perc.site = will be the site name.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: ant_file
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: com.percussion.sitemanage.task.impl.PSAntEditionTask

Extension.name: perc_AmazonS3EditionTask
Extension.initParam: perc.site = will be the site name.

Extension.name: perc_PSSiteimproveEditionTask
Extension.initParam: Third party integration edition task for siteimprove

Extension.name: perc_UpdateTablesEditionTask
Extension.initParam: perc.site = will be the site name.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: template
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: the name of the template which contains table definition

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: state
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: State the item should be in before being workflowed.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: trigger
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: Name of the trigger to use for workflowing the item if its in the right state.

Extension.name: perc_PushFeedDescriptorTask
Extension.initParam: Pushes feed descriptors to the feed service on the delivery tier.

Extension.name: sys_flushPublicationCache
Extension.initParam: Edition task which invokes the cache manager to flush the cache.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: maxUrls
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The maximum number of urls to flush before a flush all is invoked on the cache. Defaults to 5000. Note that the name of the cache region must match the name of the current site.

Extension.name: sys_purgePublishingLog
Extension.initParam: Purging expired publishing log entries. The task result contains the following context variables, which can be used in notification template (both subject and body fields): $numberOfDays (String type, the number of days of the expired log entries. This is specified in the parameter of the extension) $enableArchive (String type, it is true if archiving expired logs to the archive location. The archive location is default to AppServer/server/rx/deploy/publogs.war/) $tools.* (utilities defined in tools.xml) $sys.taskName (String type, the name of the task) $sys.completed (Boolean type, it is true if the job was completed; otherwise false) $sys.problemDesc (String type, the problem description in case of execution failure) $sys.executionDatetime (Date type, The starting date and time of the execution) $sys.executionElapsedTime (Long type in milli-seconds. The duration of the execution)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: numberOfDays
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The number of days in the past for which to preserve expired logs. Logs created farther in the past will be purged. Defaults to 30 days if not specified.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: enableArchive
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: If TRUE, expired logs will be archived before purging.

Extension.name: sys_purgeScheduledTaskLog
Extension.initParam: Purging expired task log entries. The task result contains the following context variables, which can be used in notification template (both subject and body fields): $numberOfDays (String type, the number of days of the expired log entries. It is defined in the parameter of the extension) $tools.* (utilities defined in tools.xml) $sys.taskName (String type, the name of the task) $sys.completed (Boolean type, it is true if the job was completed; otherwise false) $sys.problemDesc (String type, the problem description in case of execution failure) $sys.executionDatetime (Date type, The starting date and time of the execution) $sys.executionElapsedTime (Long type in milli-seconds. The duration of the execution)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: numberOfDays
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The number of days of the expired log entries. Default to 30 days if not specified.

Extension.name: sys_runCommand
Extension.initParam: Run a native command. The task result contains the following context variables, which can be used in notification template (both subject and body fields): $command (String type, the native command defined by the parameter of the extension) $tools.* (utilities defined in tools.xml) $sys.taskName (String type, the name of the task) $sys.completed (Boolean type, it is true if the job was completed; otherwise false) $sys.problemDesc (String type, the problem description in case of execution failure) $sys.executionDatetime (Date type, The starting date and time of the execution) $sys.executionElapsedTime (Long type in milli-seconds. The duration of the execution)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: command
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The command to run.

Extension.name: sys_runEdition
Extension.initParam: Publishing an Edition. The task result contains the following context variables, which can be used in notification template (both subject and body fields): $editionName (String type, Edition name, defined by the parameter of the extension) $tools.* (utilities defined in tools.xml) $sys.taskName (String type, the name of the task) $sys.completed (Boolean type, it is true if the Edition publishing was completed; otherwise false) $sys.problemDesc (String type, the problem description in case of execution failure) $sys.editionName (String type, The name of the published Edition) $sys.siteName (String type, The name of the published Site) $sys.editionLogUrl (String type, the URL can be used to view the Edition Log) $sys.failureCount (Integer type, the number of failures in this publishing run) $sys.successCount (Integer type, the number of successfully published pages) $sys.executionDatetime (Date type, The starting date and time of the execution) $sys.executionElapsedTime (Long type, in milli-seconds. The duration of the execution)

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: editionName
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: The name of the Edition to publish.

Extension.initParam: Load and parse user control XML documents from the filesystem and add to the result document.

Extension.name: sys_CategoryDropDown
